name: MIDI Player
description:
This algorithm plays standard MIDI files, outputting the MIDI messages, and converting the MIDI to CVs and gates. It will use an internal clock (using the file's tempo, if specified), or sync to analogue clocks or incoming MIDI clock.

See the MicroSD card section above for information on supported MIDI file formats, and how to arrange the files on the card.

Optionally, this algorithm will also process live MIDI.

While the MIDI/CV converters built into this algorithm are convenient for simple monophonic use, you may like to pair this algorithm with Poly CV (below) for more flexibility.
short_description: "Plays MIDI files from the MicroSD card"

parameters.name: Folder
parameters.default: Chooses the folder of MIDI files on the card.

parameters.name: File
parameters.default: Chooses the MIDI file within the folder.

parameters.name: Play
parameters.description: Starts/stops playback using the internal timebase.

parameters.name:
Start from
bar
parameters.description:
Sets the bar number within the file from which to
start playback.

parameters.name: File change
parameters.description:
Sets the behaviour when a new file is chosen. The options are:
●
Wait until the end of the bar and then change
to the new file.
●
Wait until the end of the file and then change
to the new file.
●
Change immediately.

parameters.name: File restart
parameters.description:
Sets how the file position changes when switching to
a new file. The options are:
●
The new file starts from the beginning.
●
The new file starts from the current position
in the old file (modulo the length of the new
file).

output_ports.name:
Output to
breakout
output_ports.description: Enables MIDI output to the breakout.

output_ports.name:
Output to
Select Bus
output_ports.description: Enables MIDI output to the Select Bus.

output_ports.name:
Output to
internal
output_ports.description:
Enables internal MIDI output – that is, MIDI is
sent to the other algorithms.
